author: Storms
title: Lacking of support
body:
Very disappointed and hurt by not being listened to from me as a long time user (expert) wishing my knowledge was more understanding and taken as a serious plead for the right help i knew was so important  
This was my experience I suffered when I achieved all goals and concurred my methadone program by reducing by two mg a month over a 12 month period at my request, but I was so shocked to be dismissed when I was no longer on their books and so desperately needed the after care which I feel is so critical when a person has achieved so much.  
This was the treatment I received by the drug service (c.g.l.) at London road in Fleetwood Lancashire. Thanks for taking my concerns seriously as I would not like this to happen again to another person who may not be as strong in his mind as i have had to be. So many thanks

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

links.id: i feel terrified that i will die

author: controllerhd45
title: Guys hospital transportation
body:
I was finished my appointment at ten in the morning in the dental implant clinic at Guys went down to transportation on the ground floor and I had to wait till 12 o’clock before I was picked up as we drove away the, driver said for me to put a mask on I told him I was exempt from wearing a face covering as I had COPD and had an lung disease,  
I said I was exempt and said I had it on my phone so the driver stopped the car just outside Guys on zigzag lines while they scrutinised it and said it was not good enough as it did not have my name on it but it was on my phone and after waiting 2 hours for transportation I did not want to get into a argument with the driver and have to go back to the transportation lounge so I took a big hit on my inhaler and looked out the window and ignored this driver. Now I live about 2 hours drive away.  
So I googled it and it said that you u are no longer legally required to wear a face covering in any settings when I reached my address I informed the driver to go to the government website and educate themselves and they continued to argue with me so I got out of the car and went into my building.  
I found this staff member to be obnoxious and rude, I am a 70 year old person with a muscle wasting disease and I felt berated.  
I have been going to Guys for the last 2 years and have never experienced this behaviour

author: microscopiumjk55
title: Birth story
body:
I want to say a big thank you to Alison, Carol and Mo in triage who took care of me during my induction.  
Secondly my deepest gratitude goes to Sarah, Amy and Caroline in labour ward, they were superb. I couldn’t have asked for a more supportive birthing team.  
Lastly to the ladies in Summerfield: Charlie, Eilidh and Olivia, thank you so much for help.

author: S411
title: Was lovely to be remembered
body: Yesterday I had a minor operation on my back. I can’t thank David, Lorraine and Joanne enough for their care. I felt so at ease. Excellent treatment. Was lovely to be remembered from being in previously too.

author: lotionpb35
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Paramedics are great girls,
body: I was transported to A&E via ambulance. A&E was very busy so I had to wait in the ambulance. Paramedics Sinead and Ciara were very good and ensured I was warm and comfortable, they included me in their conversations which was nice. A&E was busy and noisy and I felt restless but this can’t be helped due to the pressure they are under. I have been in 1 south for about 16 days now and all the staff are good. The physio’s have been helping build my strength up as I have been SOB.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: turkeycd39
title: Very professional staff
body: i had my contraceptive implant removed and the nurse that removed it and the lady who was observing were both very professional and lovely they made me feel at ease about the procedure i didn’t feel a thing and the nurse was very gentle she was also very informative with my new form of contraceptive and overall really good at their jobs and i felt comfortable talking about any concerns i had to do with the contraceptive.

author: zuzacek
title: Excellent physiotherapy service
body:
I had been on waiting list for physiotherapy for 6 months before getting an appointment for my sore back that started circa year ago. Mahiri has been absolutely excellent, in very short time I started to feel better, I wasn't able to sleep a good full night, put my socks on or sit down comfortably. I am now able to do all that and enjoy some games and fun with the kids.  
Mahiri was also very accommodating if I had to bring my kids with me due to childcare issues. Only wish the waiting time was shorter than 6 months.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: m's mum
title: Obstetrics, poor communication from consultant
body:
I attended maternity triage at the end of October with high blood pressure, headaches and feeling generally unwell. Triage were fantastic and completed a blood pressure profile, CTG, bloods and commenced me on medication to control my blood pressure. I was told to contact my community midwife the following day to request urgent consultant review.  
The following day I spoke to my community midwife, who requested consultant review. As I am a nurse, I was able to monitor my own blood pressure and observations daily. My consultant was due to call me on 3 days later as part of the telephone obstetric clinic, I did not receive a call.  
On Monday (4 days later) I had my routine midwifery appointment and was told that perhaps the consultant clinic ran over and that the consultant may call me in the next few days but to ensure I am not missed, I was added to todays obstetric consultant clinic for a call , which again, I have not received.  
Whilst I have been monitoring my own blood pressure, I feel that there has been a lack of care from my consultant ( who at 34 weeks pregnant, I have yet to meet). I was told in June, that I will have a face to face appointment with my consultant at 35 weeks pregnant in order to discuss my request for C-Section- I as of yet have received no appointment for this either. I feel let down by my consultant and frustrated at the lack of communication, which is causing me undue stress and anxiety. I feel that I have been overlooked and that despite having a consultant led pregnancy, there has been no one leading my pregnancy care.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Great Practice
body: The management of the Flu vaccination on 28th was brilliant. Well organised very polite, professional staff at the front - meet end. Many thanks. I have been attending the Practice  for many years and the reception have definitely improved markedly. Staff is more friendly, discreet, knowledgeable and organised Thanks again for your hard work

author: LDTM
title: I had my booster
body:
What an amazing team of NHS staff and volunteers you have working at the Vaccine Clinics!  
I had my booster yesterday and had to bring my 2 year old with me. All the staff made such a fuss of her; chatting to her, giving her a glove balloon and biscuits. This really helped keep me calm whilst waiting my turn. At the end she said what a lovely time she'd had! 🙂  
Thank you for all you do for us.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: AnnJA
title: Well organised Covid booster and Flu vaccination
body:
I attended the Garioch Vaccination Centre in Inverurie (NHS Grampian) today for my Covid booster and Flu vaccination.  
I arrived in good time and there was plenty space in the car park. From the moment I entered the Centre I found the staff to be efficient, helpful and very friendly. Clear Covid guidance was given. Everyone wore masks and with good social distancing and plenty of hand sanitiser available I felt very safe.  
The nurse who gave me the injections who was clearly very busy, still found time to chat to me and seemed interested in me as an individual - it could so easily have felt like a conveyor belt.  
The whole process was well organised and a most enjoyable experience!

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Great practice
body: All staff were very helpful and extremely efficient. I was provided with all the information that I needed. Thank you NHS,

title: The best
body:
Having excellent service from Whitley house in the past, always on time with reviews/ blood tests etc.
Let's get on to coronavirus. I had a booster booked two weeks ago, but had a horrendous cough and cold, rung reception and was answered within 30 seconds.
Booster cancelled and a new appointment given straight away.
So let's see, first appointment booked in January, extra car parking arranged, car parking overseen.
Second jab, so well organized as well, so now yesterday I had my second appointment for my covid booster, what can I say? absolutely first class, doctors and reception staff, all out to maintain safety, i.e. Anti bacterial, masks, and two metre separation etc.
Thank you so much Whitley House, to the doctors, reception and all the team, it is so much appreciated. xx

author: Jaygee
title: Unorganised departments & cant get through on phones easily
body:
Poor telephone service to start off with, I can never get straight through to Department. Then when connected by their operator, left hanging on for a long time.  
I feel like the eye clinic and the E.N.&T departments are unorganised, always promise appointments that are never kept (a bit better this week) I have been taken off treatment by mistake, and in the Eye Department I have seen 10 different doctors, for a weeks treatment I am given 1 months worth of tablets, Very disappointed with North Devon District Trust

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic place and amazing staff
body: My son attended today to have a tooth removed under general anaesthetic.    From the moment we walked in it was a calm and friendly experience, putting my son at ease straight away. Extremely well organised process from admission to discharge. The team that looked after him were brilliant with him, almost making it an enjoyable experience if that’s possible having a tooth out! Thank you very much!

readBy.name: Alder Hey Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding practice
body: What an amazing team, patient focused. Dedicated caring and extremely responsive. Difficult to get through on the phone but you need to put that down to the demand and pressures the NHS and general practices are currently under! However, what a fantastic service and a hard working team. A credit to the NHS.Thank you!

author: paulster
title: Professional and efficient
body: I attended day surgery at Queen Margaret Hospital for my right knee to reconstruct an ACL tear and sort a bucket-handle tear to my medial meniscus. The quality of organisation and care was superlative: professional and efficient but with appropriate and fun banter thrown in. Steven and Helen and the other nurses were very caring, Kim the physio was brilliant, the surgeon Dr Walmsley and the other surgery staff who anaesthetised me were superb. I cannot express my gratitude enough, especially given the pressures the service is currently under. Top class.

title: Lovely staff
body: Went in with short notice due to sudden pain and the receptionist found a doctor for an examination squeezing into the doctor's tight schedule. Very considerate and thorough.

title: Above and beyond
body:
The local pharmacy had failed to deliver my 95 year old mother’s medication, and said they wouldn’t be able to deliver until the following day, at the earliest, as their driver had let them down. I live 200 miles away, so was unable to collect it myself. In desperation I rang the surgery to see if there was anything they could suggest. 
The receptionist took my details, said she would speak to the Dr and ring me back. She rang back about an hour later and said she would collect the medicine from the pharmacy and deliver it to my mum herself once she had finished work. Which she did an hour or so later.
I am very grateful, and feel this was well above and beyond normal duties. 
I am disappointed with the pharmacy, but so pleased my mum is with a GP surgery that has such caring and dedicated staff.

author: lionkh56
title: A huge Thank you & great 'Sips till Send' initiative
body:
My mum fell in her garden on an evening in October and sustained a fractured neck of femur. She was admitted to Ninewells ED around 11pm, where she had excellent care from the medical & nursing teams.  
She was moved to ward 9, trauma admissions in early hours of the morning. The staff who cared for her during her stay were excellent, caring and kind. She especially remembers a staff nurse called Ross who was on duty on the night shift. He was exceptionally thoughtful and kind, she wanted to mention how frightened she was and how much Ross reassured her, something which she will never forget. Although there were too many names to remember, all other staff on the ward - nursing and care, medical, AHP, students, housekeeping and domestic were friendly and professional too.  
The clinical care was excellent - mum especially appreciated the 'Sips till Send' initiative, being able to keep her mouth comfortable right up to the point of theatre made such a difference to her. I have a nursing background, and am aware of the Hip Fracture Standards. In addition to the benefit of Sips till Send, I particularly appreciated that mum had her surgical procedure within 14 hours of her fall and that her early mobilisation has contributed to her progress to date.  
We also wanted to mention how appreciative we are of the continued efforts of the hospital teams, despite the enduring difficult conditions arising from the pandemic situation.  
As her nominated visitor, it was very helpful for me to be able to book my visit slot earlier in the day to allow me to travel to & from my home in East Lothian.  
Also I want to mention a very kind young switchboard operator who so sensitively explained to me that my brother would not be able to go into ED to accompany mum, which saved him a fruitless late night journey.  
Although a separate team, mum also wanted to thank the ambulance crews who took her to Ninewells and brought her home, who also were kind and highly professional.  
Thank you from mum and our family.

author: Cookie03
title: Friendly & professional service
body: I had my coil replaced. Anna was fantastic friendly, professional and made me feel completely at ease and comfortable given the procedure. They lady who was with her, who forgive me I cannot remember your name, was also fantastic and watched over me to ensure I was okay. They are both a credit to the sexual health clinic, talking through each step of the procedure and giving me time to breathe between each step. Thank you for getting me a drink when I was a little faint after my fitting it was really appreciated. Hopefully, I will see you both in 5 years. Thank you x

author: Staffonbehalf
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: One Recovery Bucks - Family Service
body: As you know I was advised by my doctor to come to one recovery because i was not coping very well with my wifes alcohol addiction Lucy - you have helped me so much in the last 3-4 years talking to you has helped me get back living a reasonable live i can't thank you enough for the help you have given me

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Lornahappy
title: Caring staff at cardiology
body:
I have had long term annual testing for Mitral valve prolapse and regurgitation. In May my echocardiogram was unsatisfactory so I had a TOE at Forth Valley Cardiology unit. This was followed in late September by a cycle based echocardiogram…… a bit uncomfortable but the Doctors and nurses and technicians were so caring and explained everything.  
I can not fault them in any way. Every member of staff was so caring. Yesterday I had a face to face consultation with my Consultant who could not have been more helpful. He took as much time as I required to talk through every angle of my medical situation. Thank you so much to all at the Cardiology unit at FVRH…… you work so well together for the care of people like me whose hearts are compromised.Thank you so much 🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻

title: Absolutely disgusting
body:
I experienced total discrimination from the receptionists they are very unprofessional and will enhance your mental health just trying to get a basic appointment.
They have no disregard for any of their patients at this surgery and need investigating just look at the other reviews on Google and you will see this is the worst practise in Birmingham. You won't get much help from this place or even get an appointment to see your doctor.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Sonnie01
title: Excellent and efficient
body:
5 weeks ago I was concerned about a health complaint. I called my GP's in Bonnybridge. A very helpful Receptionist allocated me a virtual near me appointment for 10 days later with advice to call back if the symptoms worsened. The near me consultation took place as planned with the GP who listened to my concerns and came up with a plan for investigations that were patient centred. I was also offered a face to face review for the next day, but I was unable to make this due to work commitments and we agreed a more suitable time for five days later. At this appointment bloods were obtained and a plan in place for follow up. 4 days after the near me consultation I received a telephone call from the X-ray department at Forth Valley Royal Hospital explaining a new list had been allocated for ultra sound and I could have the investigation the gp requested that week. This was a time frame from referral to investigation of under a week. I attended the X-ray department in Stirling Care Village where all the staff from the volunteers, X-ray admin and radiographers carrying out the investigation where professional and welcoming.  
Today, 2 weeks after my initial near me consultation I have received a telephone call from the GP to discuss the outcome of the investigations.  
This story also reflects a similar journey that my husband has also experienced when he has a near me consultation at the same surgery, which has resulted in prompt referral to the appropriate services at NHS Forth Valley.  
In a time when NHS services are pushed to extreme I wanted to say thank you as this patient journey has been flawless and an excellent example of "right care, right place, first time"

author: Tweety10116
title: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
body: Diagnosed at 11. Started medication at 13. Ups and downs and was told I will need a heart transplant, however we can't know when exactly so it has been difficult to prepare and also very scary.

author: GFur93
title: Upper gastroscopy procedure
body:
I attended for an upper gastroscopy.  
This was my fourth scope and as always I was very apprehensive. The first nurse who admitted me was super nice and listened to my worries.  
I was then escorted round to the ward to be prepped for my scope. I was taken relatively quick. I was adamant I was getting sedation as I have done every other time. My endoscopist had got me ready for the procedure when then realised I hadn’t had my cannula inserted, it took approx 5 attempts but eventually couldn’t get a good vein for sedation so I had to get throat spray. I was absolutely terrified at the thought of this and knowing everything that would be happening around me. I was inconsolable but the endoscopists and two nurses were fantastic at calming me down. I had my throat spray administered and the procedure started a couple of seconds later, the procedure overall lasted about 3/4 minutes. It wasn’t the most pleasant experience but it was bearable and I made it through. I was super worried about gagging, retching or even vomiting but again the nurses/endoscopist told me this was normal and not to worry. I was laughing by the end of it.  
I just want to say a huge thank you to them. They settled my fears, kept me so relaxed through everything and even saw me ugly cry at not getting sedation. I can’t fault them, if covid was not about I 10000% would have hugged them all. Thanks to them if I ever need another upper gastroscopy I know I can get throat spray and I will be ok.  
Please pass this message on to the three of them if you can.  
An overall pleasant experience after my melt down.  
I will happily tell people if they need a scope to get it, the thought is a million times worse.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: filingst98
title: Over the phone appointment
body: Excellent service from the doctor very friendly and happy thank you

author: LesleyM
title: Staff were so good with him
body: Our little boy attended yesterday for a hernia repair.  Staff were so good with him and very creative especially the nursing & anaesthesia team.  This helped so much with stress of situation.  My little boy was lovely and calm when  he had his anaesthetic and this helped us both.  Thanks again.

author: Bedrestonly21
title: A terrifying experience a lot more pleasant
body:
I had day surgery only yesterday. Every single one of the team were amazing, so friendly & approachable, from Fiona who booked me in & fought me for blood 😂 The lady who cleaned my bed & made general small talk helping to put my nerves at ease a little. May, who chatted with me for a while about everything & anything when there was a slight delay in getting me onto the operating bed. The anaesthetist & drs in those last few minutes before I went under, I remember you asking me my favourite tipple & me trying to tell you about the champagne id enjoyed a few nights before while viewing my recent wedding photos/video.  
Felt like id drank 2 bottles when I woke up in recovery 😂 And finally the patient ladies who looked after me in those 3 hours bed rest making sure I was comfortable before leaving for home, even though I was the last one to leave. You all made a terrifying experience a lot more pleasant.  
I am due to have an unrelated surgery in the coming months, i'm not sure if it is through day surgery but I most definitely will go in to it with slightly less anxieties after the top care I received yesterday.  
Thank you so much to everyone, you have all been through so much the last 20 months & it was amazing to see it doesn't seem to have affected morale

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Dave65
title: Unable to visit my elderly mother
body:
My 91 year old mum was admitted following a fall in which she sustained a fractured wrist and pelvis.Unfortunately during this time she contracted Covid. Visiting was limited to once a week and obviously now no visiting. As her main carer and daughter this has been an awful time not being able to be there for my mum.  
The one thing which has made this bearable for myself and family is the virtual visiting service.  
We so much appreciate the efforts of all involved in providing this invaluable service.  
The staff are very accommodating and understanding and given that they may be your first port of contact this is a crucial interaction to get right when dealing with patients and relatives who are understandably under considerable emotional and physical distress .  
I know this service was devised as a result of Covid but I really feel this is something which has real value even when the pandemic passes.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
